stimulusHtml: Which of the following is the most serious limitation of the graph regarding the importance of North America as a destination of enslaved persons over the course of the transatlantic slave trade?

features.html:
• For each data category, the following bars are shown:
    • 1619–1750
    • 1751–1860
  • All values are approximate.
  • The Enslaved Africans Arriving data for the 4 categories are as follows:
    • Northern United States:
      • 1619–1750: 21,000
      • 1751–1860: 18,000
    • Chesapeake:
      • 1619–1750: 101,000
      • 1751–1860: 38,000
    • Carolinas/Georgia:
      • 1619–1750: 48,000
      • 1751–1860: 176,000
    • Gulf States:
      • 1619–1750: 10,000
      • 1751–1860: 20,000

choicesHtml: The graph does not provide data for the period after 1860.
The graph does not give a breakdown of arrivals on British versus French versus Portuguese ships.
The graph does not show how the numbers included in it compare with numbers for the rest of the Americas.
The graph does not list the gender distribution of the enslaved persons arriving per each period.
